intro: Hoya odorata subsp. taytayensis, commonly known as the Taytay hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Hoya odorata subsp. taytayensis is also noted for its slow growth and preference for well-draining soil.
